{"id":312247969,"lang":"python3","time":"1 year, 4 months","timestamp":1584163460,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"100 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/312247969/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"12.9 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def findMedianSortedArrays(self, nums1, nums2):\n        import math\n        a,b = sorted((nums1,nums2),key=len)\n        m,n = len(a),len(b)\n        after = int((m+n-1)/2)\n        low = 0 \n        high = m\n\n        while low < high : \n            i = int((low+high)/2)\n            if after -i -1<0 or  a[i] >= b[after -i-1] : \n                high = i\n            else : \n                low = i + 1 \n        i = low\n        next_few  = sorted(a[i:min(i+2,m)] + b[after - i : min(after -i + 2,n)])\n        return (next_few[0] + next_few[1-((m+n) % 2)] )/2","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays"}
